captions.text: Our second game is called "Questions Only".

Everybody plays, but it
begins with Elidio and Andy.

I need a place. People in the
middle, give me a place.

Here's the deal: In this game
they can only talk with questions.

They say: "Are you okay?",
"How are you?" Only questions.

No one can make an interjection,
it's only questions.

When Andy asks a question
and Elidio can't keep going,

he gets out and Mari comes in.
And they take turns.
This dinner is great isn't it?
Do I look like your mother?
Wasn't there going to be a cake?
Do we need a birthday to have cake?
Do you hear what I'm saying?

- May I help you?
- Did I call you?
Didn't someone here order a waiter?

My mother-in-law hired a waiter?
For what?
Why are you being so rude?
Why are you being so nosy?
Why don't you let him play?

Some other... Please, I want
to hear your opinions.
I just want to make it clear that Mari,

when we began to make this
exersise, she didn't know...

She said:
"Oh, I don't wanna do this one..."

And she beat everybody.
I mean, fuck you.

- Well, poetic. - I want to make
it clear that I rehearsed once,
only this one, and I was thinking:
You'll see the garbage coming next.

Keep that impression:
"Cool, she did it!"

Oh, the "mother-in-law's house"
guy is your friend!

He said:
"Mari, I'll say this one now!"

- She was practicing "mother-in-law's"
at home. - I practice questions.

See, none has anything
to do with mother-in-law.

Just say "Why?" "Who?"
Do it at home, it's fun.

- Great way to talk to your mom.
- That's it.

comments.text:
é o mesmo que "onde está os pequenos" EXEMPLO: kade(gíria)= onde está e 
Baixinhos= diminutivo de baixo (os pequenos que neste caso indica crianças) 
A apresentadora de um programa de tv infantil "Xuxa" usava essa expressão.. 
(obs) observação: a expressão correta é "cadê" o "k" é usado de maneira 
incorreta apesar de ser muito comum.
